decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | The alterations to the building permitted, shall be executed wherever possible by re-using existing materials or similar second-hand materials or, if necessary, new materials to match the existing building.  The following materials and details are required to be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing before the development is commenced.  - Sample of slate; - Details of the type, number and location of the slate ventilators; - Details of the ridge/hip treatment; - Details of mortar mixes for repointing of stacks and flauchings; - Sample of bricks for repair of spalled areas; - Details of lead to be used for flashings, soakers and aprons (a code should be specified); - A method statement for and details of timber repairs; rot treatment and strengthening works; - Details of insulation materials (a breathable membrane should be used); and - Details of new rooflight.  REASON:	To safeguard the architectural and/or historic interest of the building, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policy B22, Replacement UDP Policy 4.6. | Details of a scheme for the protection from weather and works to secure the safety and stability of that part of the building which is to be retained, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and such measures shall be undertaken before building operations commence or within such other period as may be agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority and shall be maintained until the approved works are complete.  REASON:	To protect the building during the period of alterations, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policy B22, Replacement UDP Policy 4.6.
description: Re-roofing, re-pointing chimneys and replacement of defective guttering (Listed Building Consent)
